metadata.title: CVE-2023-38427 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 6.3.8.fs/smb/server/smb2pdu.c in ksmbd has an integer underflow and out-of-boundsread in deassemble_neg_contexts.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-38427` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-102-generic - 5.15.0-102.112
linux-image-5.15.0-102-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-102.112
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-102-generic - 5.15.0-102.112
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-102-generic-64k - 5.15.0-102.112
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1054-kvm - 5.15.0-1054.59
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-102.112').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2, was needed').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1054.59').
